La vison de cette structure c’est inclu: The aim of this structure is to include women and people in vulnerable situations in our programs. The inclusion of these young people is crucial for their emancipation and integration, and we will continue to develop initiatives adapted to their specific needs.
Les programmes existants ont rencontré u: Existing programs have had some significant success, positively impacting the lives of young people. Assessments show increases in professional skills, self-confidence and community engagement. The professional training and programs attracted many participants, with a 55% improvement in employability (socio-professional integration and youth entrepreneurship) in the last twelve following participation. Our international partnerships with local businesses facilitate access to employment opportunities for young people. They will be determined to improve and expand their programs to meet the changing needs of young people, thereby promoting their empowerment and integration into society.
Le ceateur/fondateur fondateur, âgé de 3: The founder/founder, aged 30 or younger, brings dynamism and an innovative perspective to our youth space. His understanding of current challenges helps create an inclusive and engaging environment, fostering initiatives that resonate with our target audience. Its presence inspires young people to become actively involved in governance, strengthening their role as agents of change. We believe this approach is essential to ensure the relevance and success of our mission
L’espace dispose numérique est partielle: The digital space is partially accessible, with an active page on social networks, an informative website and activity reports currently being published, which promotes visibility and engagement.
Avec une participation de 70% des jeunes: With a participation of 70% of young people in governance, this demonstrates a fairly considerable inclusiveness and the formalized system remains a challenge to overcome.
L’organisation a encleché un dynamisme d: The organization has been dynamic in establishing contacts with regional and international networks, which shows its potential for expansion and exchange of good practices.
Le lieu est facilement accessible en tra: The place is easily accessible by public transport and has access ramps for people with disabilities. Additionally, online resources are also available for those who cannot travel.
Les activités proposées sont basées sur: The proposed activities are based on an assessment of youth needs, including practical workshops, mentoring and networking events, all of which received positive evaluations from participants.
L’espace offre une programmation réguliè: The space offers regular programming with weekly and monthly events, ensuring a continuous presence for young people.
La structure s'engage à assurer l’inclus: The structure is committed to ensuring the inclusion of women in our activities. . We have implemented various initiatives (creative, cultural, educational activities and mentoring programs, which have helped to strengthen their confidence and professional skills. The inclusion of women is crucial for their emancipation and community development, and we will continue our efforts to promote their empowerment.
La structure valorise la satisfaction et: The structure values ​​the satisfaction and engagement of young people in our space by regularly collecting their feedback via questionnaires and discussions, which helps them adapt our programs to their needs. Also encouraging their active involvement in the design and delivery of activities, thus strengthening their sense of belonging and developing their leadership skills. Their role in leading the workshops creates a collaborative learning environment. She is proud of this inclusive approach and will continue to work to improve the satisfaction and engagement of young people.
L’espace est conçu pour être accueillant: The space is designed to be welcoming and inclusive, with anti-discrimination policies in place. Initiatives to promote cultural diversity are regularly organized.
L’espace organise régulièrement des évén: The space regularly hosts community events and workshops, maintaining a strong community presence and active support.
La structure considère la représentativi: The structure considers the representation of young people in vulnerable situations as essential for inclusive governance. We actively integrate these young people into our decision-making bodies, including those with disabilities and from single-parent families, through advisory councils and discussion forums. This approach allows us to express their needs and influence our decisions, thus promoting their emancipation and informed decision-making. The structure is committed to continuing to promote this representation to ensure that every young person can contribute to change.
La structure valorise la diversité dépar: The structure promotes departmental diversity by including young people from all departments of Congo Brazzaville, beyond two capitals (political and economic). This geographic representation is essential to adapt their programs to the specific needs of different communities. She has set up initiatives to reach young people in less represented departments, by organizing activities in rural and peri-urban areas. Through international and local partnerships, it has mobilized often neglected groups (Indigenous population). She is proud to have established balanced representation, and we are committed to creating equitable opportunities for all young people, strengthening their national impact.
L’association établie des structures cla: The association establishes clear structures allowing young people to influence their strategy, budget and activities, in particular through advisory councils and participatory mechanisms. These initiatives ensure that young people’s voices are heard and integrated into decision-making, thereby strengthening their responsibility and sense of belonging. These platforms also promote the exchange of ideas, enriching their approach and capacity for innovation. They are convinced that the involvement of young people is essential for the success of their initiatives and will continue to refine these mechanisms to guarantee their central role in our organization.
L’espace dispose d’un lieu physique acce: The space has an accessible physical location, well located and poorly equipped to accommodate young people (meeting room, coworking space, etc.).
L'ONG a maintenant 22 ans d'existence, n: The NGO is now 22 years old, our space has effectively operationalized its activities in less than 24 months, developing solid structures and establishing strategic partnerships. Various activities have been organized, such as training and community events, which have strengthened their presence. Thanks to feedback from participants, we were able to adjust our services. In addition, we have created participatory governance mechanisms, allowing young people, particularly those in vulnerable situations, to influence the management of space. We are confident in their ability to continue to grow and meet the needs of our community.
Le soutien communautaire et les partenar: Community support and strategic partnerships are crucial to the growth of our structure. It has established collaborations with local organizations, businesses and institutions, which allows them to access to mobilize resources and financing on an international scale. By working closely with the community, she adapted their activity programs to the needs of young people, by offering training. We also organize community events to strengthen local connections and encourage youth engagement. These synergies promote the development of young people and the sustainable development of our community, and will continue to explore new opportunities for collaboration to increase their impact.
Au cours de l’année passée, notre progra: Over the past year, our program has served more than 500 young people in the Republic of Congo, 75% of whom are aged 18 to 30. Through workshops and training, 80% of participants learned new skills, and 60% found a job or started their own business. We included 30% rural youth, 40% girls and 10% youth with disabilities, ensuring equitable access to opportunities. Their commitment to marginalized groups and their measurable impact underline our determination to improve the well-being of young Congolese women.
L’espace fonctionne depuis 8 ans et auss: The space has been operating for 8 years and as functional nowadays, and although it is relatively old, it has already shown significant results and significant growth.
Le projet répond spécifiquement à des dé: The project specifically addresses local challenges such as youth unemployment and lack of access to entrepreneurship training in rural areas. By collaborating with local businesses, it creates employment opportunities while supporting the local economy.
La structure a établi un modèle de finan: The structure has established a sustainable financing model which guarantees the continuity of our activities. This model is based on the diversification of sources of financing, international partnerships with TFPs and companies, as well as considering the implementation of initiatives to create income-generating activities and the mobilization of domestic resources. By monitoring their indicators (programmatic and financial performance) and adjusting strategies, the structure will ensure model effectiveness. This will allow them to continue their mission and optimize the impact on the young people we serve.
La structure a créé un modèle d’interven: The structure has created a replicable and extensible intervention model, adaptable to various contexts thanks to principles of inclusion and active participation of young people. Successfully tested in several communities in our respective departments, this model has proven its flexibility, responding to the realities of urban and rural areas. It provides tools and resources, such as guides and training, to help other organizations replicate their approach. By promoting this model, it aims to inspire other initiatives and contribute to positive change on a larger scale, while remaining committed to enriching it to effectively respond to the needs of young people.
La structure est fière d’avoir reçu la n: The structure is proud to have received the nomination and validation of several local networks, which reflects our commitment to the community and reinforces their credibility. These recognitions give them access to resources and collaboration opportunities, facilitating the exchange of best practices and the enrichment of our programs. By mobilizing the community and encouraging the involvement of young people, we see this validation as a driving force to improve their services and expand our impact. They remain committed to maintaining strong relationships with their local partners to achieve their common goals and promote sustainable development.
La structure privilégie une approche fon: The structure favors a network-based approach, promoting collaboration and exchange between members rather than a formal membership model. This creates a dynamic environment where young people share their experiences and ideas, strengthening their engagement. By encouraging interactions, we facilitate the development of joint projects and mobilize varied skills, increasing the impact on the community. This flexibility also promotes the inclusion of different groups of young people, allowing them to participate according to their interests. We believe that this collaborative approach is essential to building a space where every voice counts and where young people can flourish as agents of change.
La structure valorisee la représentation: The structure values ​​the balanced representation of young people from urban and rural areas, with around 50% of our participants coming from each background. This diversity enriches their programs and makes it possible to integrate varied voices for inclusive initiatives. It has implemented targeted strategies, such as local partnerships and outreach programs, to reach young people in rural areas and overcome accessibility barriers. By promoting this representation, the structure is committed to offering each young person, whether urban or rural, the opportunity to actively participate and benefit from their opportunities.
Le projet utilisera une plateforme numér: The project will use an interactive digital platform for training and mentoring, allowing young people to access online resources and connect with mentors remotely. In addition, workshops on social entrepreneurship are integrated, promoting sustainable solutions.

Les services fournis les plus récurrents: The most recurring services provided relate to (i) disease prevention (HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria), (ii) psychosocial support and (iii) training. These activities are mainly focused on raising awareness, improving the quality of life of young people and reducing inequalities in health, the empowerment and protection of young people. These services provided partially reflect real needs, with regard to their needs expressed/identified during the various interviews carried out in terms of entrepreneurship, training and skills development, socio-professional integration, guidance and advice, mentoring and sexual and reproductive health. Although this thematic domain focus shows consistency in the actions taken, it also reveals a lack of variety in approaches.
La priorité est donnée aux jeunes de 18: Priority is given to young people aged 18 to 30, often in situations of socio-economic vulnerability, with particular attention paid to the inclusion of women, who represent a significant proportion of beneficiaries, approaching parity. However, coverage remains limited for rural areas and youth with disabilities, calling for greater regional and social inclusion in programming to meet the needs of these populations.
L'impact des espaces jeunes sur les béné: The impact of youth spaces on beneficiaries aged 18 to 30 in the structures visited is low, with an average score of 60%. These spaces contribute to strengthening skills, employability and citizen participation, but face difficulties linked to difficult access to financing, information, digital technology... To improve their situation, it is essential to support these spaces in capacity building in terms of leadership, entrepreneurship, community engagement, empowerment, mentoring... and to expand interventions to reach a greater number of young people, in particular by strengthening the capacity to be able to reach the maximum number of young people and increasing national scope.
Dans la plupart des organisations rencon: In most of the organizations met, inclusiveness is generally satisfactory, with good integration of women and certain vulnerable groups. However, further efforts are needed to strengthen universal accessibility. The positive dynamic in terms of gender and social equity must be consolidated. The main challenges to be addressed concern disadvantaged areas and young people with disabilities, who require particular attention to improve their access to opportunities.
La gouvernance est participative dans le: Governance is participatory in the many structures encountered, with significant involvement of young people in decisions, reflecting a score of 70% which indicates a solid base but still improving. Many organizations promote inclusive governance, with active participation of young people in decision-making bodies, but the lack of formalized mechanisms sometimes limits the effectiveness of governance. Consultative and participatory mechanisms are deployed to involve young people in strategic, budgetary and operational choices, but better institutional structuring is necessary to strengthen the transparency and effectiveness of these spaces.
Les espaces jeunes obtiennent un score d: Youth spaces obtain a score of 71% in sustainability, which shows relative institutional stability. These structures have already been in existence and in operation for at least 7 years, with continuity in their activities, which demonstrates their sustainability and their ability to adapt to the changing needs of the community. In terms of financing, the spaces are dependent on external donors, which weakens their sustainability. However, it is important to build an innovative economic model to ensure their continuity.
Les espaces jeunes sont répartis de mani:
Youth spaces are distributed unevenly across the Congolese territory and initiatives are concentrated in the two large cities (Brazzaville and Pointe-Noire) and little present in rural areas. The main factors are: Rural exodus, demographics, economy, Infrastructure and Conflicts. This imbalance reduces the accessibility of young people far from large urban centers. It is essential to deploy a more inclusive national strategy in order to reduce inequalities at the national level.
The geographic and contextual balance of youth spaces in Congo-Brazzaville is a complex challenge that requires a global and coordinated approach to meet the needs of young people and promote their socio-economic development.
Les espaces jeunes Congolais rencontrés: The young Congolese spaces encountered have capacities for innovation, particularly through the use of digital tools (training platforms, distance mentoring) and the integration of social and environmental dimensions is common. These spaces are experimenting with solutions adapted to local realities. Originality constitutes an instrument of positive differentiation. The potential is significant for the emergence of scalable solutions in the digital and social economy, thus offering opportunities for expansion and impact on a larger scale for the benefit of young people.
Les espaces jeunes au Congo Brazzaville: Youth spaces in Congo Brazzaville play an essential role for young people and The spaces are considered welcoming. However, improvements are necessary, particularly in terms of accessibility, especially for young people with disabilities, and safety. (i) Strengthening services: Although the services offered are relevant, it is crucial to strengthen them, particularly in terms of digital equipment and office materials. This will allow these spaces to improve the frequency and implementation of their activities; (ii) Involvement of young people: It is also fundamental to involve young people more in governance. By involving them in decision-making bodies, we can increase their skills and their satisfaction as well as their commitment; (iii) Quality of infrastructure: The quality of infrastructure and services requires reforms. Disparities remain between urban and rural structures; those located in cities are generally better equipped and offer better quality services. These inequalities persist despite efforts to reduce them and (iv) Modernization of infrastructure. Upgrading infrastructure remains a priority to ensure equitable access.
Avec un score de 75 %, la plupart des es:
With a score of 75%, most young spaces present a reproducible model. For example, the Young Leader Space focuses on training and awareness, offering professional programs adapted to young people's needs. This type of structure includes workshops on entrepreneurship, digital skills and personal development, while training young people in foreign language interpreting and foreign language and technical professions such as baking and IT.
Their community roots and partnerships strengthen this capacity to reproduce in other localities. However, the lack of sustainable financing poses an obstacle to large-scale expansion.
Youth spaces have significant development prospects, provided that sustainable measures are implemented. To ensure their growth and sustainability, it is essential to strengthen community support as well as collaborations with local and international organizations.
Tous les espaces jeunes visités sont off:
All the youth spaces visited are officially registered with the Ministry of the Interior and Decentralization of the Republic of Congo. The majority of structures, operating as NGOs or associations, benefit from legal recognition, which strengthens their credibility and their access to funding. Structures financed by international donors enjoy a certain flexibility, but they must respect procedures and reporting requirements. In addition, these spaces are held accountable to their members and donors.
However, differences in status between structures can lead to gaps in governance and efficiency. Institutional harmonization could therefore improve their collective effectiveness.
Les défis majeurs concernent la mobilisa: The major challenges concern the mobilization of stable funding, geographical expansion and the inclusion of marginalized young people. Weak infrastructure also remains a significant obstacle. Finally, dependence on external donors endangers sustainability. These challenges are accentuated by a lack of coordination with other youth space organizations and platforms. To overcome these limitations, the structuring of a concerted national approach is necessary. The main issues also include the extension of the geographical scope and the inclusion of young people in vulnerable situations, in order to ensure better consideration of the needs of all young people.
Les besoins prioritaires des espaces jeu:
The priority needs of young people in Congo Brazzaville are both varied and pressing. Among the main needs identified, we find:
Long-term funding: Sustainable financial support is essential to ensure the sustainability of initiatives; Training and employment: Access to suitable training programs is crucial to improving the employment prospects of young people; Access to information and communication technologies: Mastery of digital tools is essential in their environment; Skills development: It is necessary to improve the skills of young people to prepare them for the challenges of their ecosystem; Equipment support: Youth spaces need adequate equipment to carry out their activities; Entrepreneurship and professional integration: Promoting entrepreneurship and facilitating integration into the job market are priorities and Sexual and reproductive health: Access to appropriate health services is essential for the well-being of young people.
To meet these needs, it is imperative to provide technical assistance that could enhance the value and impact of their initiatives.
In addition, youth spaces express an urgent need for sustainable funding and strengthening of their institutional capacities. Improving infrastructure and providing equipment support are also priorities. Sustained technical support would help increase the quality and effectiveness of their actions. Finally, these needs underline the importance of developing strategic and lasting partnerships.
Dans l’ensemble, les espaces jeunes renc:
Overall, the youth spaces encountered in Congo Brazzaville present several opportunities, mainly thanks to the existence of partnerships with international donors and international agencies.
Firstly, in the context of training and support, the European Union, through the French Development Agency (AFD), offers interesting perspectives to young people. For example, the “EMATELI” project offers training and support for young entrepreneurs, particularly in the agriculture, tourism and industry sectors. In addition, the “STAGI” project facilitates the professional integration of young graduates by offering them internships in various sectors.
Second, civil society organization platforms also represent a valuable resource. They help strengthen the support and opportunities available to young people.
In addition, the dynamism of young Congolese spaces constitutes an essential factor of expansion. Indeed, this commitment makes it possible to mobilize more resources and initiatives in favor of young people.
Furthermore, the digital environment offers innovative perspectives which can help to broaden the impact of the actions undertaken.
 It is important to emphasize that these opportunities can be catalyzed by inclusive national strategies, which would optimize the use of resources and maximize the benefits for young people in Congo Brazzaville.
Les partenaires clés identifiés sont : A: The key partners identified are: French Development Agency (AFD): finances development projects in the Congo in the areas of education, health, agriculture and professional integration of young people; European Union (EU): finances development projects in the areas of governance, peace and security, human development and the environment; African Education Foundation (FAE): finances education and professional training projects for young people; Research and Technological Exchange Group (GRET): finances development projects in the areas of agriculture, access to drinking water and sanitation; French Embassy: finances the “MOSALA” project for the professional integration of young people, support for skills training and employment for young people with a focus on the sectors of agriculture, sustainable tourism and industry and United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA): finances projects in the field of reproductive health and the fight against gender-based violence. These international partners bring significant added value to projects funded for NGOs or youth spaces in Congo Brazzaville, in terms of technical expertise, financing, network and partnerships, strengthening capacity, access to resources and credibility and legitimacy.
Tous les espaces de jeunes rencontrés au: All the youth spaces encountered in Congo Brazzaville, the majority of their funding comes mainly from international donors and partner NGOs. Local or public contributions remain limited. This dependence weakens autonomy and requires diversification of resources. The development of hybrid models combining public, private and community funding appears essential.
Le contexte congolais se caractérise par:
The Congolese context is characterized by a structuring political, institutional and social environment for the analysis of youth spaces and the organizations that operate there.
Political and institutional context
The country remains marked by persistent political and social tensions, inherited from the civil conflicts of the 1990s–2000s, particularly noticeable in Brazzaville. The youth voluntary sector operates in an environment strongly regulated by public authorities, with significant influence of the State on youth organizations. This proximity between the institutional sphere and the associative fabric results in a partial politicization of CSOs, particularly in the capital, and in increased vigilance around initiatives targeting young people, particularly in the run-up to the 2026 electoral deadlines.
Differentiated territorial dynamics
The dynamics observed differ greatly depending on the territory.
Brazzaville concentrates a majority of youth organizations and spaces, but many of them have a low level of operationality, limited technical capacities and a marked dependence on one-off funding opportunities.
Conversely, Pointe-Noire, the economic capital, stands out for its greater orientation towards entrepreneurship and training, although the incubation ecosystem still remains limited and in the process of being structured.
Secondary towns (Dolisie, Kinkala, Ouesso) appear poorly covered by existing systems, despite their potential, particularly in terms of environmental, agroforestry and commercial issues. 
Socio-cultural reading of youth
The consultations highlight a weakening of the community bond and a feeling of growing individualization among young people. The most frequently cited values ​​relate to integrity, discipline and a sense of community, reflecting strong expectations around human, civic and social skills.
Furthermore, certain terminologies, notably the term “leadership”, may be perceived as politically sensitive in the Congolese context, which influences the way in which youth initiatives are received and appropriated. 

Vulnerability: a contextual reading
Vulnerability in Congo-Brazzaville is mainly social, health and structural, more than strictly economic. It concerns in particular:
• people living with HIV, often young and out of school;
• indigenous populations, faced with social and administrative marginalization (lack of civil status, limited access to basic services);
• young women exposed to increased forms of precariousness and violence.
This reality highlights a gap between the classic categories of vulnerability and the situations observed on the ground, requiring a contextualized reading of the targeted audiences. 

Structuring operational constraints
The functioning of youth spaces and the mobilization of young people are strongly affected by recurring structural constraints, in particular:
• prolonged power outages,
• unstable or expensive access to the Internet,
• climatic conditions (rain) limiting travel.
Youth participation relies largely on informal and digital networks, which can generate fluctuating mobilization and variable continuity of activities
